org.jetel.data.formatter

Interface Formatter

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IHadoopSequenceFileFormatter
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractFormatter, BinaryDataFormatter, ByteBufferFormatter, CloverDataFormatter, DataFormatter, DBFDataFormatter, DelimitedDataFormatter, FixLenDataFormatter, JExcelXLSDataFormatter, StructureFormatter, TextTableFormatter, TreeFormatter, XLSFormatter, XLSXDataFormatter, XmlFormatter, XmlWriter.XmlFormatter, XSLTFormatter

    public interface Formatter
extends java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable
    Interface to output data formatters
    Since:
    December 30, 2002
    See Also:
    OtherClasses

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Formatter.DataTargetType
      This enumeration is used by #getPreferredDataSourceType() method to suggest preferred data source type by a Parser.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closing/deinitialization of formatter
      void finish()
      This method writes all data (header, body, footer) which are to write, but doesn't close underlying streams.
      void flush()
      Flush any unwritten data into output stream
      Formatter.DataTargetType getPreferredDataTargetType()
      Formatter can request specific data target type, which is preferred to be passed into setDataTarget(Object) method.
      void init(DataRecordMetadata _metadata)
      Initialization of data formatter by given metadata.
      boolean isDirect()
      Used in MultiFileWriter.writeDirect(CloverBuffer).
      void reset() 
      void setAppend(boolean append)
      This method should be used to inform formatter about type of writing to data target.
      void setAppendTargetNotEmpty(boolean b)

      Sets output data destination.

      Formats data record based on provided metadata

      Writes a raw serialized record.
      int writeFooter()
      Formats footer based on provided metadata

      Formats header based on provided metadata

      • setDataTarget

        void setDataTarget(java.lang.Object outputDataTarget)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Sets output data destination. Some of formatters allow to call this method repeatedly.
        Parameters:
        outputDataTarget -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if previous data target throws IOExcpetion on close()

      • isDirect

        boolean isDirect()
        Used in MultiFileWriter.writeDirect(CloverBuffer).
        Returns:
        true if writeDirect(CloverBuffer) should be called instead of write(DataRecord).

           throws java.io.IOException

      • finish

        void finish()
            throws java.io.IOException
        This method writes all data (header, body, footer) which are to write, but doesn't close underlying streams. TODO remove this method, flush() is good enough, see CL-2196
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getPreferredDataTargetType

        Formatter.DataTargetType getPreferredDataTargetType()
        Formatter can request specific data target type, which is preferred to be passed into setDataTarget(Object) method. This is intended just a hint for source provider, so other types of data targets should be expected.

      • setAppend

        void setAppend(boolean append)
        This method should be used to inform formatter about type of writing to data target.
        Parameters:
        append - true if append mode of writing is used; false otherwise

      • setAppendTargetNotEmpty

        void setAppendTargetNotEmpty(boolean b)
        Parameters:
        informs - the formatter that appending to a non-empty file is being performed
